page.title: 15LONGFORGAN - CHILDS DAY -
page.content: My name is Jane and I am 10 years old. I woke up at 7.30 a.m. and dressed by the fire downstairs. I had breakfast and then washed and cleaned my teeth and brushed my hair which is very long. I walked to school and we did maths and dictionary work and I also had a shot on the computer. Lunch was at 12.30 p.m. and I had hot-dogs and orange juice at home. Back to school for 1.30 p.m. and the afternoon went very quickly. At playtime we played skipping and one of the games was called "one two three o'high". At 3.30 p.m. we all went home. I did my homework and watched Grange Hill on TV and had tea at 6.00 p.m. We had chicken, runner beans and a new sauce Mum had made. Dad and Mum and I had tea together and it was delicious.Dad works as a cartoonist in Dundee, and after tea I practised piano.
